Name: Heaphy Hut and Campsite
Description: The Heaphy Hut is located right next to one of New Zealand's oldest and most interesting archaeological sites - an ancient village situated on a nearby river bank, believed to have been settled by Polynesians in the 13th - 14th century.

Name: Brown Hut and Brown River Campsite
14 mile marker
Description: One of the last original distance markers on the track.

Name: Giant Northern Rata trees
Description: Great photo spot! Marvel at two giant Northern Rata across the river from Lewis Hut.

Name: Heaphy bridge
Description: Completed in 2012 this magnificent structure replaces the Lewis and old Heaphy bridges.
